title: Data corruption when mixing `@FormParam` and `MultivaluedMap`
body:
### Describe the bug

A RestEasy Reactive handler method such as the one shown below which consumes `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`, declares at least one `@FormParam` method parameter, and declares a `MultivaluedMap<String, String>` method parameter to receive all the form parameters as a map corrupts the value of the last form parameter in the request body by appending two `-1` bytes to it.

```
@POST
@Consumes(MediaType.APPLICATION_FORM_URLENCODED)
public void demo(@FormParam("bound") String bound, MultivaluedMap<String, String> params) {
    System.out.println("bound=" + bound);
    params.forEach((k, v) -> System.out.println(k + " -> " + v));
}
```

Curl command to submit test values:
```
curl -i -X POST -d 'bound=this+value+is+bound+to+a+method+parameter&unbound=this+one+is+not&corrupt=this+one+has+junk+at+the+end+because+it+is+at+the+end+of+the+request+body' http://localhost:8080/demo
```

Resulting output:
```
bound=this value is bound to a method parameter
unbound -> [this one is not]
corrupt -> [this one has junk at the end because it is at the end of the request body��]
bound -> [this value is bound to a method parameter]
```

The bug is in the `FormBodyHandler.CapturingInputStream` class here.
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/2.7/independent-projects/resteasy-reactive/server/runtime/src/main/java/org/jboss/resteasy/reactive/server/handlers/FormBodyHandler.java#L133-L135

It does not check for a `-1` return value from the delegate `read()` call before appending to the `ByteArrayOutputStream`. The following change fixes the bug.

```
@Override
public int read() throws IOException {
    int res = delegate.read();
    if (res != -1) {
        baos.write(res);
    }
    return res;
}
```

### Expected behavior

The value of the last parameter in the request body is not corrupt

### Actual behavior

The value of the last parameter in the request body has two `-1` bytes appended to it

### How to Reproduce?

[demo.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/7981672/demo.zip)
